tutorial.moduleOverview: This topic covers the foundational concepts of large language models, including neural networks, transformers, and training data impact.
learningObjectives: Understand the basics of neural networks
Explore the impact of training data on large language models

introduction.heading: Neural Networks
introduction.paragraph: Neural networks are the building blocks of large language models, mimicking the structure of the human brain to process and learn from complex data.

introduction.heading: Transformers
introduction.paragraph: Transformers are a type of neural network architecture that has revolutionized natural language processing tasks by enabling parallel processing of words in a sequence.

introduction.heading: Training Data Impact
introduction.paragraph: The quality and quantity of training data play a crucial role in the performance of large language models, influencing their language generation and comprehension abilities.

tutorials.title: Advanced Concepts in Large Language Models

tutorial.moduleOverview: This topic delves into advanced concepts in large language models, including prompt engineering, bias and fairness, and evaluation metrics.
learningObjectives: Explore bias and fairness considerations in LLMs
Learn about evaluation metrics like BLEU and ROUGE
prerequisites: Understanding of large language model architectures
Familiarity with natural language processing tasks

introduction.heading: Prompt Engineering
introduction.paragraph: Prompt engineering involves designing effective prompts to guide large language models towards desired outputs and improve their performance in specific tasks.

introduction.heading: Bias and Fairness in LLMs
introduction.paragraph: Bias and fairness issues can arise in large language models due to the biases present in the training data, impacting the model's decisions and outputs.

introduction.heading: Evaluation metrics
introduction.paragraph: Evaluation metrics such as BLEU and ROUGE are commonly used to assess the quality of generated text and translations produced by large language models.
